fields.summary: Participants of a changeset don't load when on a custom domain (BB-6036)

fields.description:
On the right side on the main page after logging in there is a list of repositories that I am following. It includes my own, and the ones I'm subscribed to. My own are private right now, and the others are generally public. It would be really nice if we could have a simple icon indicating that status.

private, public and owned, followed, for example by using colors for owned/followed and using the same icon as used elsewhere for public/private.
fields.summary: Repository View on main page could use some icons to indicate private/public repo's. (BB-5115)

fields.description: The site is not rendering properly int IE8. It does seem to work in FF 15
fields.summary: Site does not render properly in IE8

fields.description: The create a team page (https://bitbucket.org/account/create-team/) is not allowing me to create a team. Whenever I fill out all of the fields and click "Create", it redirects back to the same page. It doesn't display any errors to let me know if I've done something wrong (all fields are filled out, so I don't know what the problem is).
fields.summary: Create Team Page not working

fields.description: As the screenshot shows
fields.summary: Users and groups in access management page are dpulicated

fields.description: I don't know if it's a bug or if it's by design, I cannot find project's followers and followings anymore, where did they go?

fields.description:
Please refer to attached PNG.\\
I am the only one committing to the repository in question, though I do so from two different machines.  I use the same ssh credentials for both.  For some reason the commits are listed on my Newsfeed page as being from "Anonymous".  However, when I click the link next to each individual commit, it's associated correctly with me.  On the Newsfeed page, when I click on the "Anonymous" link, to see who Anonymous is, I get a 404.
fields.summary: 404 anomaly

fields.description: See attached...

https://bitbucket.org/sai/iweekly

But after I tried various ways I realized that I need to use this form, actually, again.

fields.description: I've got an error message when I'd like to add my valid email address. Please find the image with the error message enclosed.
fields.summary: email address

fields.description:
The titles for the repo list on the dashboard shows "all", "following" and "mine" (and "teams"), however the "following" just essentially shows the same as "all" as it shows all my repos as well as other followed repos.

The repos that I expect to be shown under the 3 columns are:

"all" - all repos that I own and those that I dont own, but follow\\
"follow" - only repos that I follow that are not mine\\
"mine" - only my owned repos\\
"team" - all repos owned by team members
fields.summary: Dashboard repo view shows incorrect list under "following" (BB-6035)

fields.description:
Issues on new api overrun into the right pane with "assignee, type, priority, component, atttachement" when there is a very long url in the issue.

see attached for screenshot
fields.summary: Issue div over-runs into issue tags div

fields.description:
Please can grouping of repos be allowed in the web interface. This has been reported previously before the redesign.

The prooposed solution given by the original requester was to use path separators  (ie slashes "/") as a mechanism for grouping (and sub-grouping) repositories.

When working with large amounts of repos, grouping the repos becomes necessary to allow easy navigation of repos (it's given in sourcetree, why not in bitbucket?).
fields.summary: All grouping repos

fields.description:
Hi,

my friend has an email "karol.zalewski@4zal.net". I wanted to send him invitation to bitbucket but I got error "Please enter a valid email address.".
fields.summary: Invalid e-mail

fields.description:
AT present, the repositories dropdown in the main menu is far less useful than the previous version. It only shows 5 recently viewed/updated report, but no mechanism to show all.

On the dashboard this is less irritating as there is a panel for all repositories, but inside a specific repo, this is almost useless as its highly inefficient to move repos.
fields.summary: Please add an 'ALL' option to the Repositories menu (BB-6031)

fields.description:
I cant push any of my projects. it returns with the error fatal: Authentication failed.\\
There is also a commit message in the newsfeed, but that does not appear in the commit log of the actual repo. When I try and click on the changelog number I get a 404

my email: mabuza@bus.msu.edu
fields.summary: Authentication Fails on Push

fields.description:
User abumami most recently committed ec7537a30025 to repository KPJTalmud https://bitbucket.org/KorenPub/kpjtalmud/changeset/ec7537a300257738c8098d333352b08e0c2b7e34

But when I (as a repository administrator) click on the user's name there I see his profile with a Recent activity report *without* that commit\\
https://bitbucket.org/abumami

By contrast, I *do* see the commit when looking at the repository\\
https://bitbucket.org/KorenPub/kpjtalmud

The only "unusual" factor here is that the commit was on a branch that has not yet been rolled back into the master, and is in fact the HEAD of that branch.
fields.summary: User's latest commit doesn't appear that user's "Recent activity" list, only the Repository's "Recent commits"

fields.description:
Multiple git commits are not showing up in the Bitbucket commit history tree.\\
A commit that is tagged still shows up in Bitbucket and you can view the tagged revision.

On the commits tab, the UI is broken, see the attached image for more details.\\
The commit is viewable and accessible using other git clients and git command line. It seems like this bug is only occurring on this particular repository.
fields.summary: Commits not showing up in the Bitbucket commit history tree.

fields.description:
My colleague did a push and it wrote it as a different user.  His .gitrc looks good.

repository: odecee-puppet\\
user: gauravve\\
bad-user: fnsonlgrv

commit:  https://bitbucket.org/odecee/odecee-puppet/changeset/908eabc322d6133a34edc7a44217c11d

I've been noticing that my user has been committing into atlassian internal repos after my departure from atlassian.
fields.summary: commits can write as a different user to the actual

fields.description:
*Description*

Viewing the "history" of a source file works correctly, however if the file has a large number of commits so that the history is paginated, it is impossible to navigate to anything past the first page of the history.

*To reproduce*

# Open a source file with a large number of commits.  As an example, I'm trying to look at this history page: https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt/history/yt/visualization/plot_window.py
# Click the page links at the bottom or the top of the page.

*Expected results*

The requested page of the history should load.

*Actual results*

When I do that on my browser (Chrome on OS X) the first page of the history loads, no matter which page is requested.  Manually opening the link in a new page just opens the first page of this history again.
fields.summary: Can only retrieve the first page of the history of a file

fields.description:
The POST service, while accepting the format user@password, seems to force to lowercase all passwords.

The workaround for now is to use a password with no uppercase characters, but other non alpha-numeric characters should work as expected.
fields.summary: POST service sending all passwords lowercase (BB-5957)

fields.description:
Pushing to my repositories doesn't seem to work over HTTPS any more.  Pushing via SSH hasn't been affected.  Whenever I try to push via HTTPS, I get an "abort: authorization failed" error.  This is using Mercurial 2.3.1 on Mac OS X 10.8.

See attached output from an attempted push.  I do not have keyring or other authentication-related extensions loaded.  My path configuration is:

[paths]\\
default = https://davidmc24@bitbucket.org/davidmc24/mongo-java-aggregate
fields.summary: Mercurial HTTPS push "abort: authorization failed"

fields.description: This is very bad for organize the bugfixing procedure. I want to be able to filter bugmessages from certain branches and hide others. Please implement or fix this.
fields.summary: Implement a way to tag an issue to a specific commit, branch or tag (BB-6034)

fields.description: Needed hardly!!!!!!!

fields.description:
Dear Sir, Madam,

I just pushed some commits to a private bitbucket repo (dcnieho/matlab-optglass). For commit 4dca351f5da5, for every file changed in the commit the changeset notes "File contents unchanged." I did have a little trouble as i amended this commit and then later accidentaly tried to merge the remote (unamended) commit back in. Cleaned that up though, and did a push --mirror. Smartgit shows the file diffs normally and cloning the repo from bitbucket to local destination also gets me everything in the right state.

So i'm not sure if this is just my fault or if there is a little bug in the bitbucket interface, as other interfaces do show the diffs.

Best,\\
Dee
fields.summary: diff not showing

fields.description: screen attached
fields.summary: Python errors on push

fields.description: I have added lots of commits to a shared repository I am working on for university and my last entry on my news feed is from 11 days ago.
fields.summary: Newsfeed Not updating

fields.description:
=== Summary === When I add a binary file and slightly change a text file, the "Email Diff" broker says the diff is too large. I would rather it include the diff for the text files and simply indicate Added/Modified/Deleted for binary files, like the command-line "hg diff" and the BitBucket website. === Background === I have a nightly script that updates a website mirror, commits the changes and pushes them to BitBucket. Whenever the change is a new PDF file (like a weekly church bulletin), the email looks like this: {{{\\ https://bitbucket.org/edbrannin/holyname-greece.org-mirror/changeset/ff056ba1ca19/\\ changeset: ff056ba1ca19\\ user: update.sh\\ date: 2012-09-04 12:29:41\\ summary: Mirror update\\ affected #: 2 files\\ Diff too large to display.\\ }}} The linked-to changeset's patch (to which I will gladly grant access for anyone investigating this) is only 1193 bytes on the command-line: {{{\\ $ hg log -pvr ff056ba1ca19\\ changeset: 47:ff056ba1ca19\\ user: update.sh\\ date: Tue Sep 04 06:29:41 2012 -0400\\ files: holyname-greece.org/Bulletins/HNJ 09-09-12.pdf holyname-greece.org/PDF files.htm\\ description:\\ Mirror update diff -r a9a212ee468d -r ff056ba1ca19 holyname-greece.org/Bulletins/HNJ 09-09-12.pdf\\ Binary file holyname-greece.org/Bulletins/HNJ 09-09-12.pdf has changed\\ diff -r a9a212ee468d -r ff056ba1ca19 holyname-greece.org/PDF files.htm\\ --- a/holyname-greece.org/PDF files.htm Sun Sep 02 06:53:07 2012 -0400\\ +++ b/holyname-greece.org/PDF files.htm Tue Sep 04 06:29:41 2012 -0400\\ @@ -63,7 +63,7 @@

Weekly Bulletins:

* *

09-09-12

09-02-12

08-26-12

08-19-12
New! Now from the right year!

}}}
fields.summary: Email Diff broker skips diff when binary files are added

fields.description: I got a pull request to merge some new image files.  When I click the big grey text which I would expect to show the picture, it instead throws a 404 page.
fields.summary: Clicking images in pull requests results in 404

fields.description:
If there is an invalid entry in the .hgsubstate file, the Bitbucket site may not show the source view and instead show an error. Fixing the file will fix the issue, but the site should handle this error better and inform the user of the invalid entry.

Specifically, the error returned by Mercurial is something like\\
{{{\\
abort: invalid subrepository revision specifier in .hgsubstate line xx\\
}}}\\
which can also be seen when cloning the repository.
fields.summary: Handle invalid entries in .hgsubstate better and inform users (BB-5939)

fields.description:
See the attached screenshot (two in one... only allowing me to have one attachment)

The first screenshot is an image of when I click the Top Menu link "Repositories".\\
The number of commits under the last repository is 0.

If you then look at the second image, I show that I have indeed contributed to that last project (sole contributor...).

I only have one login and am the only contributor to that project... Any reason why the number of commits would be zero?
fields.summary: My number of commits isn't showing up under a repository I am the controller of

fields.description:
When I open a page of my project on bitbucket.org I see a top menu related to this one. It has an item "Issues (count)" that refers to page with a list of currently open issues (with "new" or "open" statuses).

Working for relatively long time on my project I mentioned that the count of open issues in menu item is not equal to the count of issues in page's title (that is just above issues' list and represents a valid value). To be more precise, the count of open issues in menu item is less than the count in page's title by one. E.g, when count of open issues is 14 I see "Issues (13)" in menu item.

I'm not sure whether such behavior correct or wrong but probably there can be page's caching issue.

A problem becomes apparent on my private repo's page: https://bitbucket.org/Arrenda/arrenda.ru/issues?status=new&status=open
fields.summary: Open issues' count in project's "Issues" menu item is wrong.

fields.description: You might want to add some ellipsis or wrapping there (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Long commit messages on the dashboard.

fields.description:
Hi,

I didn't find any documentation about this, but it would be very nice to use the RestAPI field of bitbucket in README files.

For example:\\
[logo] would display the project logo\\
[website] would be a link to the website url in the repo

and so on, this would make writing READMEs for lots of projects a lot easier.
fields.summary: Implement RestAPI fields of bitbucket in README (BB-6037)

fields.description: Hi, I would greatly appreciate it if the wiki could also use markdown pages. Not necessarily the ability to edit (although that would be awesome) but at least the ability to display markdown files (.md) inline much like the readme file does from the git repo.
fields.summary: Markdown syntax for the wiki

fields.description:
{{{\\
#!sh

Step 1:   Create a repo\\
Step 2:   Create a deployment key.\\
Step 3:   Ooops!   That should have been an SSH key - delete deployment key!\\
Step 4:   Try (try!) to add that key to SSH keys\\
==> denied:  "That key is used as a deployment key"\\
sync, reset, reboot, wait.... repeat - cannot add that key to your SSH (w/ in 1/2 hr);\\
give up, and generate a new key, specifically for bitbucket:\\
Step 5:   upload newly generated key;\\
Step 6:   Try (try!) to push to repo\\
==> $ hg push ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/yarko/clinicaltrials-svc/\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/yarko/clinicaltrials-svc/\\
running ssh -C hg@bitbucket.org 'hg -R yarko/clinicaltrials-svc/ serve --stdio'\\
remote: conq: repository access denied. deployment key is not associated with the requested repository.\\
a        bort: no suitable response from remote hg!

Step 7:  check keys (locally):  ssh-add -l\\
==>  original key (used elsewhere), and new (bitbucket specific) keys present.\\
Step 8:  $ ssh-add -d  $(that_first_key)\\
==>  now it works;

}}}\\
Ugh!
fields.summary: ssh access, deployment keys sticky creating problem

fields.description:
The {{{repositories}}} endpoint does not seem to expose the Google Analytics and Akismet keys for management.

It would be nice to manage these programmatically: if you have a lot of repositories, manually setting or changing these keys is a bit of a pain.
fields.summary: REST API: repositories endpoint lacks Google Analytics / Akismet keys (BB-5925)

uploaded file *******.zip to account/repository
fields.summary: An object handle is rendered instead of the name of a repository on the Dashboard (BB-5926)

fields.description:
It has always bothered me how the DAG gets interrupted in each page, I was just reading this article about endless pagination ( http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/2012/03/the-end-of-pagination.html ) and thought it would be something nice to see here.

When one is browsing the change history, one tries to follow the DAG lines, but this flow is interrupted by pagination, so it would be nice to have each page load upon scrolling.

Also, since page numbers aren't persistent (page one has a new meaning each time there are enough new commits) I don't think something like this would have a negative impact.
fields.summary: Endless pagination for commit history in Commits tab (BB-5927)

fields.description:
I've set up a custom domain which properly takes me to my bitbucket content.  I also have a wiki page with an image. The image was uploaded to bitbucket via git (as described in the docs).

If I access bitbucket via my custom domain (code.mydomain.com), the image doesn't appear on the wiki page - it's broken.  If I access it directly using the bitbucket domain (bitbucket.org/myaccount/...) the image appears correctly.
fields.summary: Images on wiki pages don't appear broken when using a custom domain

fields.description:
From a customer request:\\
There should be a way to get the repository events that happened after a certain time period using a new paramater with a date.
fields.summary: Add time/date as an option to repositories / events API (BB-5748)

fields.description:
I can't find a way to log out of bitbucket on my iPhone.  The Log out button is hidden in a popup menu, which don't work on devices without a concept of "hover".

A more accessible menu, or some separate CSS for mobile devices would at least make bitbucket usable on mobile devices without having to pay for an app.
fields.summary: Mobile friendly menus (BB-5928)

fields.description: Another user sent me a pull request to his fork, but the fork is private, so my only option is to reject it. the system should either warn the sender or provide a link to the receiver to request access.
fields.summary: it's possible to send a pull request to someone who does not have read privileges for a repo (BB-5936)

fields.description:
Hi! It would be nice if we could create a list inside a table cell. I know this can be tricky since the list markup must be on a new line but the new line end the table. Exemple wiki code\\ {{{\\ #!wiki |=Heading 1|=Heading 2|\\ |\\ *Item 1\\ *Item 2|No list here|\\ }}} XHTML it should produce\\ {{{\\ #!HTML
Heading 1 Heading 2
  • Item 1
  • Item 2
 No list here
}}}Current XHTML\\ {{{\\ #!HTML
Heading 1 Heading 2
  • Item 1
  • Item 2|No list here|
}}}
fields.summary: List inside a table (BB-5933)

fields.description:
We have a huge problem with uploads to our repository. The connection will almost always get closed by the server when we try to upload some huge commits (>100MB mercurial patch bundle). The error number is 10053 and - sometimes - 10054.

The position when the connection gets closed seems to be random (sometimes after a few MB and sometimes after ~160 MB). Our upload speed is 3MBit/s.
fields.summary: Upload errors

fields.description:
Hi,

With git version 1.7.9, it's possible to sign all commits. It would be really nice if bitbucket can enforce this signing (so bitbucket would refuse any pushes with unsigned commits) optionally for a repository.
fields.summary: Allow enforcing gpg signatures

fields.description:
Hi all,

We have been trying for the past hour to get into our repo without success.  I think it may be because of a stalling approval for a pull request.  This is a major blocker for us as it is preventing us from deploying our code to production.

Below is the error we get:

Guru meditation: 2a015e99bbbe42778087ae4b3b148950$f64f7ac1549a07c749e9b1fc0aeeb439

Please let us know ASAP what can be done to resolve this issue.  Our repo is:

https://bitbucket.org/ampushsocial/insight

Thanks.

Alok
fields.summary: Cannot Access our Repo!

Please see the attachment.
fields.summary: Empty message boxes under 'commits' page

fields.description:
On behalf of a support request:

Could you please add SAS to the list of available programming languages?\\
Or, at least just an "other" category?
fields.summary: Add SAS to the programming language list (BB-5923)

fields.description:
Currently, there is a "build query" button that allows the user to build custom queries, but those custom queries are note saved.

Please add the ability to save custom queries. If you are worried about webpage design and real estate, then Maybe allow the user a maximum of 2 or 3 buttons to be saved (meaning, 2 or 3 queries max to save).

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add buttons for saved custom issue tracker queries

fields.description:
I recently did a source re-organisation on one of my projects using hg rename

This means that when I now view the file online there is no history prior to the rename shown in the BitBucket interface.  I am aware that the hg command line client requires the --follow argument to follow renames so it appears that BitBucket does not utilize this (or the programmatic equivalent)

Even if this is not enabled by default for projects it would be useful to be able to enable it on a per-project basis.  Also it would be useful to allow users to enable this on a per-file basis when browsing the source (possibly even include a per-user preference on whether they want to always follow renames)
fields.summary: History for a File does not follow renames

fields.description:
As the guy's in the channel have no idea I'll try it this way.

I run the qwebirc on debian squeeze with all packages installed as told.\\
IRCD is an snircd 1.3.4a\\
I configured the server to connect to directly with IP to bypass any DNS problems.\\
Aswell I binded the outgoin IP on the actual right IP. On top I created a new rule especially for that connection in the firewall to acceppt both IP's on any port and protocol.

qwebirc starts with no errors and is accessable via the given domain.\\
So far all looks good. But as you want to connect there is always the same error: Couldn't connect to remote server.

However I tried different settings like connecting on localhost, connecting with name instead of IP. tried different modes, but decided to run on None.\\
Everything I do ends up in the same error and I really don't know what else I could do.

I hope you have any suggestions about what it could be.\\
As far as I know, the ircd itself doesn't need any special config for qwebirc to connect to due it just "relates" the webuser with a "virtual" irc cleint as a user to the ircd, so it shouldn't need any config there.

I would be very thankful for any advice or suggestions what it could be or what else I can try.
fields.summary: Big connecting problem

The font in the search box is too large. See attached image
fields.summary: Search box on support page font to big

fields.description:
Dear Sir, Madam,

First of all, thank you for the great product, I'm using it very happily and am very happy with some of its unique features.

When clicking "Repositories" in the UI, the "My repositories" view shows up. I have some issues with this view however:

# its very liberal in its use of space and only shows ten repos,
# this is especially annoying as there do not seem to be sorting options

So therefore I would hope something along the lines of the following enhancements would be considered:

# condense the view, making the gravatar images optional/smaller and keeping all info on one line
# have an option to set how many repos to show on one page, and increase the default from the current 10
# have the option to sort repos at least on the following: 1. name of repo, 2. name of user/owner, 3. both 1 and 2, so as currently printed, 4. creation time, 5. last update time

I thought its best to flag this as minor, though its kinda major for me as well, as it would greatly increase my use of the site. I have to go to dashboard now to get some kind of normal listing of repositories.

Thank you for considering,\\
Best,\\
Dee
fields.summary: Improve "My repositories" view (BB-6074)
Make /commits an alias for /changesets (BB-5917)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

h1. create a repo named "foo"
h1. delete the repo, providing a redirect URL
h1. create a repo named "foo"
Expected behaviour:

Either the operation should succeed (possibly after providing a warning) or a helpful error message should be displayed.
fields.summary: Creating a repo with the same name as a deleted repository fails silently (BB-5922)

fields.description: The download repository was made public today. Now I can't access it and the repository has become unavailable even to me after logging in. What is wrong. Surely it does not take so long to update.

Hi,

I am trying to reset my account password and the email that I receive with the link to reset the password is taking me to missing page on the website.

Regards

fields.description:
Hi,

I've got the following line in my README.md file:

You can install it by clicking [here|https://my.webfaction.com/new-application%3Fscript_url%3Dhttps://bitbucket.org/kboi/webfaction-tomcat-installer/raw/default/TomcatInstall].

And I've got the reference in the end of the file like that:

I push the file on the server but the link points to the same Overview page.

You can see this at https://bitbucket.org/kboi/webfaction-tomcat-installer under the Installation header.

I think this is a bug, rather than a misconfiguration of mine as the Markdown Dingus at http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus, renders the same code correctly.
fields.summary: Your markdown implementation doesn't parse a URL correctly (BB-5921)

fields.description:
Assume that A and B are a members of the team T.\\
B creates a repository under the account of T. Said repository will be reachable through https://bitbucket.org/T/newrepo. Team member A may not access newrepo at all, whether read nor write nor admin.

If A checks https://bitbucket.org/T/ now, the creation of the repo is visible to A, even though (s)he has no access.
fields.summary: Creation of hidden repositories listed on page of a team account (BB-5954)

fields.description:
There's a link to the blog entry for the "add 1 free user to your plan limit" promo, but the url in the href is shortened by some sort of centre truncation and has an ellipsis in the middle of it.

"http://blog.bitbucket.org/2012/09/18/refer-a-friend%E2%80%A6for-free-users/" should be "http://blog.bitbucket.org/2012/09/18/refer-a-friend-to-bitbucket-for-free-users/"

fields.description:
== Description ==\\
Viewing the "History" of a source-file that's not in the master branch never works.\\
Triggers a "404 - The page you are looking for seems to be missing".

== To reproduce: ==

h1. Create a new branch, e.g. "testbranch"
h1. Add a new file to the branch "NEWFILE.txt" and commit it
h1. Make some changes to the file and commit it
h1. Go to bitbucket source viewer, change branch to "testbranch" and click on the "NEWFILE.txt"
h1. Click the "history" button
== Expected results ==\\
The history of the file and the ability to view it at different revisions

== Actual results ==\\
Page with "404 - The page you are looking for seems to be missing".
fields.summary: Viewing "history" of file never works => 404 Not Found

fields.description:
There is currently no way to deselect the language choice for a repo in the admin section. The drop down will only allow you to select a different language even though you can create a repo with no language selected. This could be useful for when a project changes and no longer uses a single language.

A //'None'// option or a little x like on the component drop-down on the issue tracker would be appreciated :)
fields.summary: No way to deselect repo language choice (BB-5916)

fields.summary: Add ability to test Services (BB-5436)
